sen.j: 阿倍 帯麻呂（あべのおびまろ、生没年未詳）は奈良時代前期の貴族。
sen.e: ABE no Obimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was a man of noble ancestry in the early Nara period.
ABE no Obimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was an aristocrat in the early Nara period.

sen.e: ABE no Obimaro (year of birth and death unknown) was an aristocrat in the early Nara period.

sen.j: 阿倍氏出身だが、系統は未詳。
sen.e: He was from the Abe clan, but his linage was unknown.

sen.e: This was the first time that the official rank, Gaii was conferred on a person belonging to the central noble class.

sen.e: In April 729, he rose to the official rank of Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: その後美作国守となるが、天平7年（735年）9月28日（旧暦）までに何人かと共謀し、故意に4人を殺害するという不祥事を起こした。
sen.e: After that, he became Mimasaka no kuni no kami (the governor of Mimasaka Province), however, he caused a scandal that he conspired with some people to kill four people by October 22, 735.

sen.cmt: *Conspiracyは共謀するものなのでwith some peopleは不要です。
sen.e: After that, he became Mimasaka no kuni no kami (the governor of Mimasaka Province), however, he caused a scandal that he was part of a conspiracy to kill four people by October 22, 735.

sen.j: この時の裁判担当だった高橋安麻呂や県犬養石次らが職務怠慢で裁判を放置したため、被害者の親族から訴えられ罪に服していたがこの日許された、と「続日本紀」天平7年9月28日条に書かれてある。
sen.e: The article of 'Shoku Nihongi' on October 22, 735 recorded that the judge including TAKAHASHI Yausmaro and AGATA no Inukai no Iwasuki left the case untouched due to their negligence of duty, but he was in jail at the suit of victims' families, then, he was released on the day.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The article of 'Shoku Nihongi' on October 22, 735 tells that the judges including TAKAHASHI Yasumaro and AGATA no Inukai no Iwasuki left the case untouched in their negligence of duty, but victims' families made allegations and he was improsoned, then, he was released on the above mentioned day.
sen.cmt: Yausmaro →Yasumaro（スペルミス）としました。
sen.e: The article of 'Shoku Nihongi' on September 28, 735 tells that the judges including TAKAHASHI Yasumaro and AGATA no Inukai no Iwasuki left the case untouched in their negligence of duty, but victims' families made allegations and he was improsoned, then, he was released on the above mentioned day.
sen.cmt: 「続日本紀」の中の日付なのでそのままにしました。

sen.j: しかし、帯麻呂に対する処分は不明。
sen.e: However, there is no record about punishment for him.

sen.j: 但し、帯麻呂のその後の消息も未詳のため、律に則り死刑になったと推測される。
sen.e: In addition, it is presumed that he was executed in accordance with the law, because there is no record about him since then.

sen.j: その昇進の経緯などから、叙位に対する不満から他の外位任官者と共に長屋王の変に関わった可能性が指摘されている。
sen.e: His promotion and other details suggested he possibly got involved in Nagayao no hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) with other officials whose ranks were Gaii because he complained about his official rank.

His promotion and other details suggested that he was not happy with his granted official rank, he possibly got himself involved in Nagayao no hen (Conspiracy of Nagayao) with other officials at the ranks of Gaii.

sen.j: 子女は平安時代初期に蔵書家として著名であったという阿倍弟当（あべのおとまさ）と藤原真楯の夫人となり藤原内麻呂を産んだ娘の2名が知られている。
sen.e: His two children were well-known; one is ABE no Otomasa who was famous as a book collector in the early Heian period and the other is a daughter who was a wife of FUJIWARA no Matate and a mother of FUJIWARA no Uchimaro.

sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処および、「時制の一致」―文法にのっとり修正、プレーンな言い回しに改正しました。
